tool.name: tleap
tool.command: ln -s '$ligandinput1' input.mol2 && bash '$tleap_script' > tleap.in && tleap -f tleap.in

configfiles.configfile:
cat << EOF #for $i, $s in enumerate( '$Forcefields' source $s #end for
ligA = loadmol2 input.mol2
#if '$ligandinputfrcmod1' loadamberparams '$ligandinputfrcmod1' #end if solvateBox ligA TIP3PBOX 14.0 iso addIonsRand ligA Na+ 0 saveamberparm ligA '$outputprmtop1' '$outputinpcrd2' quit EOF

param.name: template_style
param.label: Select a template style for tleap:

param.name: dimension
param.label: Uniform distance or differing x,y,z distance

param.name: distance
param.label: Distance. minimum distance between solute and edge of a periodic box

param.name: distancex
param.label: Distance x. minimum distance between solute and edge of a periodic box

param.name: distancey
param.label: Distance y. minimum distance between solute and edge of a periodic box

param.name: distancez
param.label: Distance z. minimum distance between solute and edge of a periodic box

param.name: iso
param.help: rotate box to orient to principal axes.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Leap - link, edit and parm - prepare input for molecular mechanics.
.. class:: infomark
**How it works**
- Select a mol input file (mol2) - Specify the correct unknown parameter
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs created**
- Outputs a frcmod file as text
.. class:: infomark
**User guide and documentation**
- AmberTools `userguide`_
.. _`userguide`: http://ambermd.org/doc12/Amber19.pdf
**Known issues** If datatype is mol not mol2, tleap decides to crash. Does not matter if a soft link is used. Fix - edit the datatype and set it to be mol2 (this is not available in the upload and must be done after).
